title: Good practice in local integration networks: lessons for policy makers and community organisations
abstractText:
This Impact Grant adds value to an existing ESRC research project on ‘Democratic anchorage of governance networks’. It will strengthen the contribution of European experience to the development of public policy on integration of new immigrants into the local labour market, education and housing systems. The project will deliver this by funding:

  1. A 24 hour developmental workshop drawing together public officials and, if possible, representatives of immigrant groups from Copenhagen, Rotterdam and Birmingham, together with researchers who have been examining integration policy in Europe, and members of our research group;
  2. Production of a short and accessible report on ‘Governance for integration policy’ that will be made available on the web and disseminated to relevant audience.

This will enable the existing ESRC award to enhance its planned policy impact processes by establishing a more productive dialogue between immigrant groups and policy actors in a face-to-face context.
